comments.body: If we talk about improving spiders, then let them attack other creatures, why only players?
I agree, spiders should target the other creature, as for why it only attacks the player is probably because it's old
Spider Man!
Spider Man!

No.

 

 

(Arachnaphobia is real. Spiders are bad enough as it is. This could be acceptable if they were the natural predators of silverfish and bees, though... that way bees would protect us from the spiders and the spiders would rid us of silverfish)
Copper is one of the materials you can use for armor trimming.
Yes copper is my trash today but if I had copper armor than it would be so nice
It's good, but I'd prefer actual birds added for it. It'd be nice to see some in forests.
No, that would be unbalanced. Trims are meant to be only cosmetic.

Actually having an item that is hard to obtain and cost dimands to make that does basicly nothing is unballanced. Difficulty should equal reward.

gold armor affecting piglins is a visual effect, piglins react to seeing gold items, drop a clock or a lightly weighted pressure plate and they go nuts, gold shoes are enough so a decent amout of trim should have the same effect, I think minimum 3 is good but could be four if they also add elytra trim.

Spending netherite should be better than spending coal, fire and lava protection is not so unballanced compaired to using the same amount to upgrade dimand armor.

lapis could bring back enchantability as an interesting early game option

activating nearby redstone is probably a bad idea, and the other minerals are renewable so should be entirely cosmetic...

but, throwing around some partical effects for redstone armor and sound effects for amythest armor would be epic.

While I don't think the specific colors should provide buffs, I do believe the patterns should provide **MINOR** buffs. For example, the snout trim set could buff average piglin trade drops like having fortune when trading. Another could be improved water breathing for the o. monument set, maybe a second per item with trim. All of these are unaffected by the color of the trim. Pick your favorite!

The idea is that the buffs justify the rarity and steep price, encourage technical and power players to bling out more as they min/max, and provide a more substantial reward for casual players' effort while also looking cool. And while the balance is a concern, the Effort required is more than justified, as netherite is a similar change to diamond, only a buff to durability and knockback resist while also being a significant effort sink.

There are already mods that have this type of system I believe it's the netherite upgrade mod, so this is possible and would make sense. Why waste precious resources for cosmetic appearances with no gain.
I don't think buffs for leather, iron and diamond are necessary. What I mainly want is for gold-trimmed armor to stop piglins from attacking you.

I do agree with you that it should give minor buffs since wasting valuable materials for just cosmetic appearances does seem to be the best way forward. These minor buff will actually incentivize exproling your world for armor trims and using rare materials in upgrading them.

Minor buffs for adding Diamond over something like iron would be nice. Playing a single player world with no one to show off your trim to makes them kinda pointless. I have some iron leggings and they're the only armor I have right now with mending on them, so being able to make them "tougher" with diamond trims would be neat. I thought that's what the point of trim was before I looked it up, since I haven't been super caught up with Minecraft updates lately.
Camouflaged creepers sounds like a good idea. Or a bad one, depending on the type of person you are.
Mob variations should have different abilities, like husk gives hunger effect, and stray slows down

I feel like this post has been suggested (many times) before... but anyway...

They should add the Mossy Skeletons from Minecraft Dungeons, and have them spawn in jungles (like the vine-covered ones you mentioned) they would should weak poison arrows. For Oceans they should have the Sunken Skeletons, which use crossbows instead of bows so they can actually shoot underwater (and they can swim too). Frozen Zombies could spawn in the snowy biomes. And Sandy Skeletons could spawn in deserts. It would be cool to see underwater slimes as well.
And the creeper will have the color of the grass in the biome.
The zombie villagers also got clothes like the villagers got, so I think mobs will eventually have more variants, but I don't think it will be now.
This isn't exactly a mob variant, but... more golems. And dragons.
it will be useful, im 1st btw
Also he should be able to fill buckets with lava from lava caldrons and swap out the buckets in the furnace. Maybe this could be a bronze golem!

I think it would look very nice, because regular torches do not match bamboo wood very well.
I don't know how this would effect the other types of wood having a torch texture though.
maybe bamboo torches would go out in the rain or something and would have to be re-lit?
And water, milk, honey, slime, berries, seeds...
And creepers, just having a tiny creeper in a pot. This could be done using a creeper head. :)
The new vase should serve as a good target game, if you hit it with an arrow and it shatters. üéØüèπ
Little blue ones ‚ÄúPeriwinkles‚Äù

In a similar vein, I'd love to see some flowering bushes that are just piles of leaf blocks with similar textures to the blossom tree. It would fill in the biomes really well to have more levels of foliage.

Biome based petals would be awesome.
I'd like to be able to dye the current ones at least.
How about a few ancient notes with broken up or ancient texts?

It would be fun to find books with stuff from Legends and Dungeons Lore, or even snippets of books from earth's history to let players decide if they were just visions/lore or history. Plus could be a fun way to build intrigue on the other games or tease potential additions to Minecraft. No better way to tease and not commit than a little fiction with a grain of truth. Plus it would give players a more RPG feel that their world has a history or at least stories.
I agree, some short stories could be pre-written in some of the saved books too.
I'm sorry but that is a you problem, the Ancient City is supposed to be endgame content anyway. If you need a tip for finding them check under mountains
No, they're supposed to be rare finds. Also a theory is to dig under mountain biomes.
it would be cool if we could find it with archaeology like a old map
That would be great for glowing armor!
I think this would be great, but maybe a way to dye the glow trims would be good as well, as I don't want to be stuck with a generic blue for the glow trims.
seria que mejoraran el  bioma dando mas profundidad al bioma con una cueva un tesoro referente a los mapas donde hay demasiados tesoros enterados
I wanted this with dyed leather armor so badly. Please add this Mojang.
Hi (hope this isn't mini modding) but you should probably explain your idea... Like, what would be there? How would you get there? Stuff like that.
I'd love a patchy moss that doesn't completely cover a block, and is place able on the sides of blocks
For example, a bamboo spear might be good for survival.
there are two types, those that are thrown similar to a trident and those that do damage in an area similar to a sword but with perforation
And you could slowly sink and suffocate to death

The idea is really cool! We already have loose snow in which we fall and freeze. In the quicksand, we could also drown and suffocate. I want to complement the idea with the fact that we can walk in leather boots on loose snow. On the quicksand, we could only move with the help of camels.
I feel like it would be better generating somewhere else (swamps, for example).

Do you want a mud variant work like quiksand ?

Personally i think it's a good idea.
They should add the palm trees and meerkats from MC Live 2018

Make desert temples better and add a secret room with good loot

This change could actually be useful for builders.
Love this idea. It would be great for more diversity in wood types! I think we‚Äôd have a full rainbow by that point.
I actually love this idea. I can't wait to see what spooky randomizers the redstone community would make from this!
The developers already had such an idea, but it is difficult to implement it.
I don't think they will add it since the shards are not considered as minings

It would give Echo Shards a new use, as by the time it would be used in a recipe, the player would already have an eccess of echo shards.

Love our idea!
And it would have a pulsating effect like the chest/heart of the warden.
I definitely agree cause we don‚Äôt really have any uses for the echo shard except the recovery compass and that‚Äôs okay but I would love to see them to be able to be use with armor trims

I think it would be cool to see villages with walls, aqueducts, cobble roads, better bridges, shops or inns, different styles of buildings, etc.
Possibly even things like attachments to mineshafts, colosseums, castles, etc.
Ruined versions of such structures could also be added to underwater ruins & ancient cities.

I second that. Searching for the ancient city in survival mode takes too long and is painful. I also thought of more items for suspicious sand. Like:

2. Skeleton skull

3. Player head

11. Firework star

13. Clock

14. Lead

16. Potion of luck

I hope developers will add some of these that could have a rare chance to get.

I think some items to definitely add to Suspicious Sand are bones, Nautilus shells (only on ocean ruin digsites), flint, lapis, copper ingots, armor trims, and leather armor. All of these items are found in real-world archaeology, and would fit the game.
This is such a good idea
you should add a chance of unique netherite armor and tolls
